title: Cynthia_sinach042
author: Cynthia_sinach042
content: Hello everyone I am very excited today as finally my boss has agreed to pay in Bitcoin. After losing at my first attempt in Cryptocurrency as I thought that wealth falls like rain here I was brought back to reality with losses I got a little job on the side although a small amount paying job I think it is okay for me and I can get back on my feet.Ever since I started working I have always been talking to my boss and coworkers about Cryptocurrency and after persisting they started to give me listening ears, I made sure to also tell them my experience and made sure they got my picture.Along the line my boss got very much interested in cryptocurrency especially in Bitcoin. Assisted him in creating his Bitcoin wallet and taught him all I could, it surprised me when he finally accepted to pay me in Bitcoin and has giving it as an option to other workers, it's a big joy for me and I believe they are also talking about cryptocurrency to their friends and family too, just got my first payment in Bitcoin this evening.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Cynthia_sinach042 on December 19, 2022, 06:57:44 PMjust got my first payment in Bitcoin this eveningWell, congrats! Is this payment for the side job or for the main job?I'm asking because for the side job it's just the perfect way to do it (imho), but for the main job, getting the full pay in bitcoin is a bit risky unless you can live from other funds and keep the bitcoins untouched for a couple of years.However, interesting move!

comments.author: LoyceMobile
comments.body: Quote from: Cynthia_sinach042 on December 19, 2022, 06:57:44 PMAssisted him in creating his accountThere are no accounts in Bitcoin.Do you really want your boss to be able to follow your money after he pays you?

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: I hope you also tell your Boss about the risks of Bitcoin assets that he uses to pay you and some of your fellow workers.it might be fun to work with your boss. he has good communication with his employees. or you may be good at persuading people.if your company is a provider of services or goods. maybe your Boss can also consider accepting payments using Bitcoin.

Getting paid in your preferred currency (bitcoin) seems a great feeling to you so congrats. My question is are you paid in dollar equivalent of Btc or the payment is an greed Btc. My advice is since this is your only major source of income at the moment and you will need some to pay bills it will be better to set side the amount yoh wish to save every pay time and then convert the rest to either stable coins or Fiat for daily use. Although we will wish to have everything in Bitcoin but its volatility won't allow that now. Also when you have some spend able amounts in fiat it gives the freedom to hodl for long.

comments.author: kamvreto
comments.body: it will be a great experience to receive Bitcoin from the work you do in your workplace. But did you also educate your boss beforehand about how much risk of losing value this poses to your boss? because cryptocurrencies have high volatility so prices continue to fluctuate. for some people this will be very disturbing and make them panic. they really have to understand the advantages and disadvantages of using cryptocurrency before carrying out full adoption, as well as the ultimate goal of what cryptocurrency they can be used for. Great experience to be a part of developing bitcoin payments.Quote from: NeuroticFish on December 19, 2022, 07:49:50 PMQuote from: Cynthia_sinach042 on December 19, 2022, 07:11:17 PMI would really want to save the Bitcoin I get from there but in case of personal needs I would touch itThis is not really the best way to invest, since personal needs can happen and then you may have to sell at a loss.But yeah, I wish you don't have unexpected expenses and the investment will stay there for long.this will be a problem, which hinders the use of bitcoin as a long-term investment, because everyone's needs will be different. they will sell bitcoin at a lower value to meet personal needs. really have to do financial management that is used as investment and used for personal needs.

comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: It's great that you were able to successfully negotiate getting paid in Bitcoin. As a digital currency, Bitcoin can be a convenient and secure way to receive payment, especially for those who may not have access to traditional banking or financial services. However, it is important to remember that Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are highly volatile and can fluctuate significantly in value. This means that the value of your Bitcoin payment may go up or down over time. It is also important to be aware of the tax implications of receiving payment in Bitcoin. Depending on your location, you may be required to report cryptocurrency payments as income and pay taxes on them.

comments.author: gantez
comments.body: Quote from: Cynthia_sinach042 on December 19, 2022, 06:57:44 PMCryptocurrency as I thought that wealth falls like rain here I was brought back to reality with losses I see you that you have attempted to may trade or investing in bitcoin and now that you have it you need to be careful and don't invest what you can't manage if you lose. You can convert some of your payment to usdt to keep for any case that you lose the investment. Don't invest all at once and this is my advising to you. Congrats to convince your boss and the colleagues you have.

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Quote from: gantez on December 19, 2022, 10:11:15 PMYou can convert some of your payment to usdt to keep for any case that you lose the investment.Why would OP go through the headache of covincing their boss to have their salary paid in Bitcoin, only to afterwards convert a part of the salary received in Bitcoin into stablecoins, if OP does that, then they should just have continued receiving their salary the conventional way through a bank account. If one decides to receive their salary in Bitcoin, they should be well and truly prepared to bear the risks involved, that's why a much better option would be to receive your salary in fiat and DCA a fraction of your earnings into Bitcoin every month.

I know the story is not as simplistic as you have narrated it. You failed to mention if it was full payment he made. Does your boss and co-workers know about its volatility? Does your boss and co-workers know about "Not your keys, Not your coins". These are things you should explain to them. Also, remember to move your bitcoins from the centralized exchange which I know it currently is now to a cold wallet so you do not return to tell us a story of "Had I known".

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: It's great to see your boss accepted to make payment for staffs including you in Bitcoin. It's good for Bitcoin adoption.Where did you receive and store your bitcoins from your boss?Is it an exchange wallet?Is it a non-custodial wallet?If you receive your payment in an exchange wallet, that is terrible. Reminder: do not keep your money in online accountsYou can lose your bitcoins anytime.If you receive your payment in a non-custodial wallet, you made a good decision.
